channel.title: math.MG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.MG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: ABP estimate on metric measure spaces via optimal transport
item.description: arXiv:2408.10725v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: By using optimal transport theory, we establish a sharp Alexandroff--Bakelman--Pucci (ABP) type estimate on metric measure spaces with synthetic Riemannian Ricci curvature lower bounds, and prove some geometric and functional inequalities including a functional ABP estimate. Our result not only extends the border of ABP estimate, but also provides an effective substitution of Jacobi fields computation in the non-smooth framework, which has potential applications to many problems in non-smooth geometric analysis.
item.dc:creator: Bang-Xian Han

item.title: Fat minors in finitely presented groups
item.description: arXiv:2408.10748v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that a finitely presented group virtually admits a planar Cayley graph if and only if it is asymptotically minor-excluded, partially answering a conjecture of Georgakopoulos and Papasoglu in the affirmative.
item.dc:creator: Joseph MacManus

item.title: Simple closed geodesics on regular spherical polyhedra
item.description: arXiv:2408.10782v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this article, we found all simple closed geodesics on regular spherical octahedra and spherical cubes. In addition, we estimate the number of simple closed geodesics on regular spherical tetrahedra.
item.dc:creator: Darya Sukhorebska

item.title: Sharp and rigid isoperimetric inequality in metric measure spaces with non-negative Ricci curvature
item.description: arXiv:2212.11570v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: By using optimal transport theory, we prove a sharp dimension-free isoperimetric inequality involving the volume entropy, in metric measure spaces with non-negative Ricci curvature in the sense of Lott--Sturm--Villani. We show that this isoperimetric inequality is attained by a non-trivial open set, if and only if the space satisfies a certain foliation property. For metric measure spaces with non-negative Riemannian Ricci curvature, we show that the sharp Cheeger constant is achieved by a non-trivial measurable set, if and only if a one-dimensional space is split off. Our isoperimetric inequality and the rigidity theorems are proved in non-smooth framework, but new even in the smooth setting. In particular, our results provide some new understanding of logarithmically concave measures.
item.dc:creator: Bang-Xian Han

item.title: Limits of manifolds with boundary
item.description: arXiv:2406.00970v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper, we develop the geometry of the limit spaces of compact Riemannian manifolds with boundary, where we assume lower bounds on the sectional curvatures of manifolds and boundaries and the second fundamental forms of boundaries and an upper diameter bound. We mainly focus on the general case of non inradius collapse/convergence, where inradii of manifolds are uniformly bounded away from zero.In this case, many limit spaces have wild geometry, which arise from the boundary behavior of manifolds. We determine the infinitesimal and the local structures around the boundary singular points of the limit spaces.We also present some global convergence/collapsing results.
item.dc:creator: Takao Yamaguchi, Zhilang Zhang

item.title: Coarse obstructions to cocompact cubulation
item.description: arXiv:2407.09275v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We provide geometric methods to both lower- and upper-bound the large-scale dimension of CAT(0) cube complexes quasiisometric to a given group $G$. When these bounds overlap, this provides obstructions to $G$ being cocompactly cubulated. More strongly, it prevents $G$ from being a coarse median space. As applications, we show that many free-by-cyclic groups cannot be cocompactly cubulated, and that any tubular group with a coarse median is virtually compact special.
item.dc:creator: Zachary Munro, Harry Petyt
